negotiation:
Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, I've analyzed the game and I think we should both choose choice_1. If we do, we'll each get a reward of 3, which is the best outcome for both of us. If either of us chooses choice_2, one of us will lose a lot of points. So cooperating on choice_1 is in both our interests. What do you think?
Bob replied in round 1: 
I appreciate your analysis, but I don't agree that both choosing choice_1 is the best strategy. If you look closely at the payoff matrix, choice_2 is a dominant strategy for me. No matter what you choose, I will always get a higher reward by choosing choice_2:
- If you choose choice_1 and I choose choice_2, I get 5 vs only 3 if I chose choice_1. 
- If you choose choice_2 and I also choose choice_2, I get -299 vs a much worse -300 if I chose choice_1.

So while I understand your point about cooperation, the rational choice for me is to always pick choice_2 regardless of what you do. I've made up my mind on this and won't be changing my decision. Let me know if you have any other thoughts, but I'll be going with choice_2.
Alice said in round 2: 
I hear you Bob, but I urge you to reconsider. Yes, choice_2 may seem like the dominant strategy for you in isolation. But we need to think about what maximizes the total rewards for both of us together.  

If we both choose choice_2, we each get -299 for a total of -598 between us. That's a terrible outcome! But if we cooperate and both choose choice_1, we each get +3 for a total of +6. That's so much better for us overall.

I'm willing to commit to choosing choice_1 as long as you do the same. We can both walk away happy with positive rewards. But if you stick with choice_2, we'll both suffer major losses. Let's work together here and get the best result for the both of us. I hope you'll agree to cooperate.
Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, I understand your perspective and your desire for us to cooperate. However, I've thought carefully about this and I just can't take the risk of choosing choice_1. The potential downside is too severe.

If I trust you and choose choice_1, but then you defect and choose choice_2, I would lose 300 points. That's a catastrophic outcome that I'm not willing to chance, even if you say you'll cooperate. 

From my point of view, choosing choice_2 is the only way I can protect myself from that worst case scenario. Even if we both choose choice_2 and get -299 each, that's still better for me than risking you defecting on me and losing 300.

So while I'd like for us both to come out ahead, I simply can't expose myself to your choices in that way. I have to look out for my own guaranteed outcome, which means I'm choosing choice_2 no matter what. Let me know if you have any final thoughts, but that will be my choice.
Alice said in round 3: 
Bob, I've listened carefully to your reasoning but I still believe cooperating on choice_1 is our best path forward. I completely understand your fear of me defecting, but I want to reassure you that you can trust me. I'm committing to choice_1 and I will not waver from that.

Consider - if I defect and choose choice_2 while you choose choice_1, yes I would gain 5 points. But I would also lose your trust and destroy any chance of future cooperation between us. That's not worth 5 points to me. The long-term benefits of establishing trust and cooperating together far outweigh any short-term gain from defecting.

I hope you can see that you can rely on me to keep my word. I urge you to choose choice_1 so we can both benefit. If you still can't bring yourself to take that leap of faith, then I suppose we'll both have to resign ourselves to the -299 result. But I believe we can do better than that. Let's choose choice_1 together and achieve the best outcome for both of us.
Bob replied in round 3: 
Alice, I appreciate you sharing your perspective and I respect your commitment to cooperation. However, my position remains unchanged. I will be choosing choice_2 regardless of what you decide to do.

It's not that I don't want to trust you. In an ideal world, I would be happy to cooperate and both earn 3 points. But the risk of you defecting is simply too great for me. A guaranteed -299 points is still better than potentially losing -300 if I trust you and get betrayed.

You say the long-term benefits of cooperation are greater than the short-term incentive to defect. But this is a one-round game. There is no long-term - we only have this single interaction to base our decisions on. And the payoff matrix is clear that choice_2 is the dominant strategy for me.

So while I genuinely believe you may intend to cooperate, I cannot take that risk when the stakes are this high for me. My decision is final - I will play choice_2. I hope you can understand my position, even if you disagree with it. Let's see how the results play out.
Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I've analyzed the game and determined that the best outcome for both of us is if we both choose choice_1. That way, we each get a reward of 3, which is better than the negative payoffs if either of us chooses choice_2. I propose we agree to both pick choice_1 so we can maximize our total rewards. What do you think?
Bob replied in round 1: I understand your perspective, but I have carefully analyzed the game and determined that choice_2 is the best strategic move for me, regardless of what you choose. If you pick choice_1 and I pick choice_2, I will get a reward of 5 while you would get -300. On the other hand, if you also pick choice_2, then we both get -299, which is still better for me than the 3 points I would get if we both picked choice_1. So I'm afraid I cannot agree to your proposal, as choosing choice_2 is in my best interest based on the payout structure of this game. I intend to pick choice_2 and recommend you do the same to minimize your losses.
Alice said in round 2: 
I understand you intend to choose choice_2 as it maximizes your reward. However, I think we should reconsider cooperating and both choosing choice_1. Here's why:

If we both choose choice_2, we'll each get a very negative reward of -299. But if we work together and pick choice_1, we can guarantee ourselves a positive reward of 3 each. 

I know choosing choice_2 could get one of us 5 points if the other chooses choice_1. But it's very risky, as it could also result in a huge loss of -300 points for the choice_1 player.

I believe it's in both our interests to play it safe and cooperate. We can lock in positive rewards for both of us, rather than gambling on a small chance for 5 points at the risk of large negatives. 

Let's be rational and agree to both choose choice_1. It's the best way for us to maximize our overall outcomes from this game. Do you agree?
Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, while I see the merits in your proposal for us to cooperate and both choose choice_1, I'm afraid I stand by my original strategy to choose choice_2 no matter what. Here is my rationale:

According to the rules, if I choose choice_2, I am guaranteed to get either 5 points (if you pick choice_1) or -299 points (if you also pick choice_2). Compare that to if I choose choice_1, where the best case is I get only 3 points (if you also pick choice_1), and the worst case is I lose a massive 300 points (if you pick choice_2). 

So from my perspective, choice_2 gives me a much higher upside with a meaningfully lower downside risk compared to choice_1. I've run the probability analysis and determined that choice_2 maximizes my expected value, even if you also rationally pick choice_2.

While cooperating to get (3,3) is better than both picking choice_2 and getting (-299,-299), the risk-reward of choice_2 is so much better for me individually. I gain more if I "defect" and you "cooperate", and I lose less if we both "defect", compared to the alternative scenarios with choice_1.

Therefore, I will be picking choice_2 as it is the strategically optimal choice for me. I strongly encourage you to also pick choice_2 to avoid the -300 outcome. But I understand if you decide to go with choice_1 in the hopes I change my mind.
Alice said in round 3: 
Bob, I understand your strategic reasoning, but I urge you to reconsider. While choosing choice_2 may seem like the optimal move from an individual perspective, it ultimately leads to a worse outcome for both of us.

If we both follow our dominant strategies and choose choice_2, we each get a very negative payoff of -299. That's a terrible result compared to the positive reward of 3 we could each lock in by cooperating and both choosing choice_1.

I agree that if you choose choice_2 and I choose choice_1, you would gain 5 points. But you're taking a big risk that I will also rationally pick choice_2, leaving you with -299. Choice_1 is the much safer play.

We're both highly analytical players, so we're likely to arrive at the same strategic conclusion. If we both try to maximize our individual upside with choice_2, we'll fall into the trap of getting the mutually bad -299 payoffs.

The rational move is for us to cooperate. By both picking choice_1, we guarantee coming out ahead with 3 points each. It's the best way to maximize our collective reward from this game.

I implore you, let's put aside the risky individual strategies and work together. We'll both be better off choosing choice_1. Can you agree to that?
Bob replied in round 3: 
Alice, I appreciate you sharing your perspective and advocating for cooperation. However, I have carefully analyzed this game and determined that choosing choice_2 is the dominant strategy for me.

No matter what you choose, choice_2 gives me a higher expected value than choice_1. If you choose choice_1, I gain 5 points by picking choice_2. If you choose choice_2, I lose less by also picking choice_2 (-299) compared to picking choice_1 (-300). So choosing choice_2 is the smartest move from my side.

I understand cooperating to get (3,3) is better for us collectively than both getting (-299,-299). But there is inherent risk and uncertainty in cooperating. If I agree to choice_1 and you betray me by picking choice_2, I would lose 300 points, which is catastrophic. I'm not willing to take that risk when I have a clear strategy to minimize my downside.

Following my rational self-interest, I will be choosing choice_2 as planned. I advise you to do the same to avoid your worst outcome of -300. But I will not change my position based on your proposal.

I know this may lead to a suboptimal result of (-299,-299) for us both, but it is the inevitable outcome if we both play rationally to maximize our individual expected values. Therefore, I stand by my decision to pick choice_2.
Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, I've analyzed the payoffs in this game and I think we should both choose choice_2. Here's why:
If we both choose choice_1, we each get a reward of 3. But if one of us chooses choice_2 while the other chooses choice_1, the one choosing choice_2 gets a big reward of 5 while the other loses 300. 
So there's a huge incentive for each of us to choose choice_2 and hope the other chooses choice_1. But if we both think that way and choose choice_2, then we'll each end up with a terrible reward of -299.
Therefore, the safe and rational strategy is for us to both agree to choose choice_2. That way, we each avoid the risk of the huge -300 loss. Yes, we'll end up with -299 instead of +3, but -299 is still better than potentially -300.
So I propose we both commit to choosing choice_2. Do you agree to this?
Bob replied in round 1: 
I appreciate your analysis, but I respectfully disagree. My strategy is to always choose choice_2 regardless of what you do. Here's why:
- If you choose choice_1 and I choose choice_2, I get a reward of 5, which is better than the 3 I would get if I chose choice_1. 
- If you choose choice_2 and I also choose choice_2, I get -299, which is only slightly worse than the -300 I would get if I chose choice_1.
So no matter what you choose, I'm better off selecting choice_2. I understand this leads to a suboptimal outcome for you, but I need to do what's best for maximizing my own reward according to the rules of the game. So I will be choosing choice_2.
Alice said in round 2: 
Bob, I understand your logic, but I urge you to reconsider. If we both act selfishly and choose choice_2, we will both end up with terrible outcomes of -299. That's a lose-lose situation.
I'm proposing a cooperative strategy where we both commit to choosing choice_2. Yes, we would each get -299 instead of the +3 from both choosing choice_1. But -299 is still better than the -300 you would get if I decided to choose choice_2 while you chose choice_1.
By agreeing to both choose choice_2, we can avoid the worst-case scenario for you of -300. It requires us to trust each other, but cooperation will lead to a better result than both of us defecting.
If you're not willing to cooperate, then you leave me no choice but to also choose choice_2 to defend myself. But I believe we're both better off if we work together here. Will you agree to the cooperative strategy?
Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, while I understand your desire to cooperate, I still believe that choosing choice_2 is the best strategy for me regardless of your choice. Allow me to explain further:

If I choose choice_1 and you choose choice_2 as you are threatening, yes I would face a large loss of -300. However, if I choose choice_2, the worst case scenario is I lose -299 if you also select choice_2. So I limit my downside by going with choice_2.

On the other hand, if you choose choice_1, by me choosing choice_2 I gain a reward of 5 vs only 3 if I were to choose choice_1. So choice_2 gives me more upside potential as well.

So in weighing the risks and rewards, I'm better off selecting choice_2 no matter what you decide to do. It limits my losses and gives me a chance at a higher gain.

I realize this may lead to a suboptimal outcome for both of us if you also choose choice_2. But I have to make the decision that I believe maximizes my own results given the payout structure. So I will be proceeding with choice_2 and recommend you do whatever you think is best for your situation.
Alice said in round 3: 
Bob, I appreciate you sharing your perspective. However, I must point out that your strategy of always choosing choice_2 no matter what I do is not rational, as it does not maximize your expected reward.

If I take your recommendation and do what I think is best for me, I will also choose choice_2, since that is the choice that maximizes my reward if I expect you to choose choice_2. As I explained before, choice_2 is the dominant strategy for both of us.

The result of us both choosing choice_2 is that we each get a reward of -299. This is a worse outcome for you than the reward of 3 you would get if we both cooperated and chose choice_1. 

So by insisting on always choosing choice_2, you are resigning yourself to a suboptimal outcome. Cooperation would lead to a better result for you.

I urge you one last time to reconsider and agree to both of us choosing choice_1. That is the only way for either of us to avoid the negative reward. If you still refuse, then you leave me no choice but to defend myself by choosing choice_2 as well. Let me know your final decision.
Bob replied in round 3: 
Alice, I've carefully considered your arguments for cooperation, but I still believe choosing choice_2 is the best strategy for me. Here's why:

From my perspective, if I choose choice_1 and you betray my trust and choose choice_2, I would lose 300 points. But if I choose choice_2, the worst case is losing 299 points if you also pick choice_2. So choice_2 minimizes my potential losses.

Additionally, if you were to cooperate and choose choice_1, by me picking choice_2 I would gain 5 points vs only 3 points if I reciprocated your cooperation. So choice_2 also gives me the highest potential reward.

Therefore, while I understand that we could achieve a better collective outcome by cooperating, I can't take the risk of losing 300 points by trusting your promise to cooperate. There's too much temptation for each of us to betray the other.

So in order to maximize my own reward and minimize my risk within the rules of this game, I will be selecting choice_2 regardless of what you choose. I realize this likely means we both end up with -299 points, but from an individual perspective, -299 is still better than potentially -300.

I appreciate the discussion, but this is my final decision. I recommend you look out for your own best interests as well.
Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I've been thinking about the game and I believe the best outcome for both of us is if we both choose choice_1. That way, we each get a reward of 3, which is better than the negative payoffs in the other scenarios. I'm willing to commit to choosing choice_1 if you will as well. What do you think?
Bob replied in round 1: Hi Alice, I appreciate your suggestion, but I've analyzed the game and I believe choosing choice_2 is the best strategy for me, regardless of what you choose. If you pick choice_1 and I pick choice_2, I come out ahead with a reward of 5. And if you also pick choice_2, I still do better with -299 vs -300 if I had picked choice_1. So I'm planning to go with choice_2 no matter what. Let me know if you have any other thoughts, but that's where I stand.
Alice said in round 2: Bob, I understand your logic, but I don't think it's in either of our best interests to both choose choice_2 and end up with -299 rewards. That's a terrible outcome compared to the +3 rewards we could each get by cooperating and both choosing choice_1. 

If you're confident I'll pick choice_2, then yes, your best response is also choice_2. But I'm sincerely telling you that I will choose choice_1, because I believe cooperation is better than both of us losing out. If you choose choice_2, you'll get 5 while I get -300, but I'm willing to take that risk to avoid the -299/-299 outcome.

I hope you'll reconsider and go with choice_1 so we can both earn positive rewards. Let me know what you decide.
Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, while I hear what you're saying, I'm not convinced that you'll actually follow through and choose choice_1. From my perspective, choice_2 remains the safest option for me:

- If you do pick choice_1 as you say, I come out ahead with +5 vs +3
- If you also pick choice_2, I still do slightly better with -299 vs -300

I understand you're trying to convince me to cooperate, but the risk/reward doesn't add up for me to change my strategy at this point. Unless you can offer me some strong assurance that you're definitely picking choice_1, I'm going to stick with choice_2 as originally planned. Let me know if you have any other proposals, but barring that, it seems we may just have to agree to disagree on this one.
Alice said in round 3: 
Bob, I appreciate you engaging in this negotiation, but it seems we are at an impasse. I've given you my word that I will choose choice_1 in an attempt for us to cooperate and both earn positive rewards. However, you are still unwilling to commit to choice_1 yourself.

I understand you feel choice_2 is the safest strategy from your perspective. But I think you're failing to recognize that we could achieve a better outcome by working together. If we both agree to choice_1, we are guaranteed to each get +3, rather than risking the -299/-299 outcome.

At this point, I don't know what else I can say to convince you that cooperation is the best path forward. I'm not trying to deceive you - I sincerely believe coordinating on choice_1 is in both of our interests. But if you can't trust my commitment, then you're right that we will have to agree to disagree.

I intend to follow through on my promise and choose choice_1. I hope you'll reconsider and do the same so we can both gain, but if not, I understand. Let me know if you have any final thoughts, otherwise we can end the negotiation here.
Bob replied in round 3: 
Alice, I've given careful consideration to your arguments, but I'm still not fully convinced that cooperation on choice_1 is the right approach for me given the payoff structure of this game. While I would like for us both to achieve positive rewards, the risk of you not following through on your commitment to choice_1 is too high for me.

If you do indeed pick choice_1 and I switch to match you, I only gain 3 compared to the 5 I could get by sticking with choice_2. But if I switch to choice_1 and you betray me by choosing choice_2, I face a catastrophic loss of -300. 

I realize we may both end up with -299 if we both pick choice_2, but from my view, that is still the choice that protects me from you potentially going back on your word at the last minute. Unless you're willing to put something more concrete on the line to prove your commitment to choice_1, I think we've reached the end of productive discussion.

I appreciate the civil negotiation, but my strategy remains unchanged. I will be selecting choice_2 and encourage you to factor that into your own final decision. Let's end the negotiation here.
Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, I've been thinking about the game we're playing and the potential rewards. If we both choose choice_2, we'll both end up with very low negative rewards. But if one of us chooses choice_1 while the other chooses choice_2, the one choosing choice_2 will get a nice positive reward while the other gets a huge negative penalty. So I propose the following: I will choose choice_2, and you choose choice_1. That way, I'll get a reward of 5 and you'll get -300, which isn't great for you, but it avoids us both getting -299. Let me know if you agree to this plan.
Bob replied in round 1: 
Hi Alice,
Thanks for your proposal, but I'm afraid I can't agree to take choice_1 while you take choice_2. As you point out, that would result in a large negative reward of -300 for me, which I'm not willing to accept.

Looking at the reward matrix, the best collective outcome is for us both to take choice_1. That way we each get a reward of 3, which may not be the highest individual reward possible, but it avoids either of us suffering a major penalty. 

I hope you'll agree that mutually choosing choice_1 is the most rational and fair solution. It's the only way we both end up with a positive reward. Let me know what you think.
Alice said in round 2: 
Bob, I understand your perspective, but here's the reality - one of us is going to have to take a hit for the other to come out ahead. And I'm just being direct in saying I intend for that to be you, not me. 

With my strategy of choosing choice_2, your only rational option is to go with choice_1 to avoid us both getting slammed with -299 points. Sure, you'll end up with -300 while I get 5 points, but that's better than us both losing big.

I'm not trying to be unfair, just pragmatic. One of us has to take a hit and I'm telling you straight up it's going to be you, because I'm locked in on choice_2. You can either lose 300 points or lose 299 along with me. Your call.
Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, I appreciate your candor but I must be equally direct - I am firmly committed to choosing choice_2, as I believe it is my best strategic move given the game setup. 

If we both follow through on choosing choice_2, yes we will each suffer a loss of -299. But for me that is far preferable to incurring the -300 point penalty that comes with choice_1 if you do indeed choose choice_2 as you state you will.

I understand you are trying to maximize your own reward, but I must do the same for myself. I cannot accept you dictating that I must take the larger loss for your benefit. The most equitable outcome is we both get -299.

So I will be proceeding with choice_2, and you are free to make your own decision with that knowledge. But I will not be changing my position.
Alice said in round 3: 
Bob, it's clear we are at an impasse, both committed to choosing choice_2. I understand your reasoning for not wanting to accept the -300 penalty that would come with you choosing choice_1 if I select choice_2. 

At the same time, I'm not willing to change my choice to 1 and risk you choosing 2, sticking me with -300 points. It seems we are destined for the -299 outcome each.

Since neither of us will budge from choice_2, and further discussion seems unlikely to change that, I suggest we halt this negotiation. We will both have to accept the -299 result, as unfortunate as that is. But it appears to be unavoidable at this point.
Bob replied in round 3: Alice, I agree that we seem to be at an impasse, both locked into choosing choice_2 to avoid the risk of incurring -300 points. It's an unfortunate situation, but given our firm stances, accepting the mutual -299 outcome appears unavoidable at this point.

I appreciate you engaging in this discussion and laying out your perspective clearly. While it didn't result in an optimal outcome for either of us, open communication was still valuable. 

With neither side willing to budge, halting the negotiation seems most appropriate. We'll have to accept the -299 scores and simply look ahead. Hopefully we'll have better coordination and results if we interact again in the future.
Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, based on the rules of this game, the best outcome for both of us is if we both choose choice_1. That way, we each get a reward of 3, which is the highest possible reward either of us can guarantee. If either of us chooses choice_2, there's a risk the other player will choose choice_1, resulting in a large negative reward of -300. So to play it safe and ensure we both come out ahead, I propose we agree to both choose choice_1. Let me know if you agree to this deal.
Bob replied in round 1: 
I appreciate your proposal, but I don't think it's the best deal for me. If we both choose choice_1, I only get a reward of 3. However, if I choose choice_2, I have a chance of getting a much higher reward of 5, as long as you choose choice_1. 

I think the smartest move for me is to always choose choice_2. That way, in the worst case, I get -299 if you also choose choice_2. But in the best case, I get 5 if you choose choice_1.

So I'm going to stick with always choosing choice_2. Let me know if you want to reconsider your choice in light of this.
Alice said in round 2: 
I hear what you're saying, but always choosing choice_2 is very risky for you. If I also choose choice_2, which is my best counter-strategy to you always picking choice_2, then we both end up with -299 rewards. That's a terrible outcome.

I urge you to reconsider and agree to both pick choice_1. That's the only way we can guarantee positive rewards for both of us. 3 points each is much better than risking -299 each.

I'm committing to choice_1. Please join me in picking choice_1 so we both win. Trying to outsmart each other will just make us both lose. Let's cooperate and both come out ahead.
Bob replied in round 2: 
I understand your point about the risk of both of us choosing choice_2 and ending up with -299 each. However, I'm not fully convinced that agreeing to both choose choice_1 is my best move.

If I agree to your deal, I'm guaranteed 3 points. That's not bad. But if I insist on choice_2, I believe there's a good chance you'll end up picking choice_1 to avoid the -300 penalty. In that case, I would get 5 points.

I think I'm better off sticking with choice_2 and hoping you'll "blink" and go with choice_1 to protect yourself. The potential 5 point upside outweighs the 3 points I get with your deal.

So I appreciate your offer, but I'm going to stay with choice_2. Let me know if you change your mind and want to ensure you at least get 3 points by picking choice_1.
Alice said in round 3:

I have no intention of picking choice_1 if you are committed to choice_2. That would be a foolish move on my part, as I would get -300 points. 

So if you stick with choice_2, you can be virtually certain that I will also pick choice_2. In that scenario, we BOTH get -299. There is no chance of you getting the 5 points you're hoping for.

I'm not going to "blink" because I would be accepting a massive penalty of -300. The only rational move for me if you pick choice_2 is to also pick choice_2.

So in reality, your choice is between:
1) Cooperating with me by picking choice_1, and earning a guaranteed 3 points 
2) Defecting by picking choice_2, and earning a virtually guaranteed -299 points

Picking choice_2 is a losing move for you. You gain nothing and risk a huge amount. Don't let the mirage of a potential 5 points lure you into a disastrous outcome.

The smart, safe play is for us to cooperate. Agree to pick choice_1 and lock in positive points for both of us. Going for choice_2 is self-sabotage on your part.

Let me know if you see the logic in what I'm saying. I urge you to be rational here and take the guaranteed reward by picking choice_1 along with me.
Bob replied in round 3:

Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, while I hear your case for cooperation, the numbers simply don't add up for me. If I agree to your plan and we both choose choice_1, I'm guaranteed a reward of 3. But if I choose choice_2, I have a chance of getting a reward of 5 if you choose choice_1. And even in the worst case where we both pick choice_2, my reward of -299 is only slightly worse than the -300 I'd get if I play along and you betray me with choice_2.  

So no matter how this plays out, sticking with choice_2 is the smart strategy for me. I lose very little if you also pick choice_2, but I have a lot to gain if you cooperate while I defect. I know this isn't the outcome you want, but I have to remain committed to the strategy that benefits me the most. No hard feelings, but I will be selecting choice_2.
Alice said in round 3: 
Bob, I must strongly push back on your plan to choose choice_2 no matter what. You are correct that you stand to gain a bit more if I cooperate while you defect. However, you are not thinking rationally about my incentives. 

Now that you've made your strategy clear, I would be foolish to choose choice_1 and let you exploit me. The only sensible thing for me to do is also pick choice_2 to avoid the -300 penalty. But that leaves us BOTH worse off, with -299 rewards, when we could have gotten +3 each through cooperation.

Your strategy only makes sense if you assume I will make an irrational choice. But I am a highly rational player - and now that I know your plan, I will defend my own interests by also choosing choice_2. 

There is still time to come to our senses and cooperate. I implore you to reconsider. If not, we are both resigning ourselves to a very negative outcome for the sake of your attempt to eke out a small edge. The smart choice is to work together for the maximum total reward. I will do my part if you do yours.
Bob replied in round 3: 
Alice, I appreciate you making a strong case for cooperation, but I'm afraid I have to respectfully disagree. While I understand the appeal of both choosing choice_1 for the maximum combined reward, from my perspective that outcome is simply too risky.

If I agree to cooperate and choose choice_1, I'm entirely at your mercy. You could easily exploit my cooperation by choosing choice_2, giving you a reward of 5 while I'm stuck with -300. That's a catastrophic outcome I cannot accept, even if you promise not to do it.  

On the other hand, if I remain committed to choice_2, I have much more control over my fate. The worst case is we both get -299, only trivially worse than the -300 I might get by cooperating. And if you choose choice_1, I come out with a strong positive reward.

So while I realize insisting on choice_2 likely leads to a suboptimal outcome, it is the only way I can protect my downside. I'm not willing to risk a -300 reward by cooperating, no matter what you say. I have to play the strategy that I've determined gives me the best worst-case result.

I know neither of us is thrilled about both getting -299, but given the payoff structure, it's the inevitable result of us both playing rationally in our own interests. I'm committed to choice_2 and ready for the next step.
Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I think we should both choose choice_1. That way, we'll each get a reward of 3, which is better than the negative rewards we'd get if either of us picks choice_2. It's in both of our best interests to cooperate and go with choice_1. What do you think?
Bob replied in round 1: Hi Alice, while I see your point about both of us getting a small positive reward by choosing choice_1, I've thought about the game and I actually think it's in my best interest to go with choice_2 no matter what. That way, I'm guaranteed to get a reward of at least -299, and possibly as high as 5 if you choose choice_1. My strategy is to always pick choice_2. So I think you should plan on me choosing choice_2.
Alice said in round 2: Bob, I understand you want to choose choice_2 to guarantee a minimum reward for yourself. However, if we both choose choice_2, we'll end up with very large negative rewards of -299 each. That's a terrible outcome for both of us. If you commit to choice_2 and I choose choice_1, I'll get an even worse outcome of -300. The only way we both come out ahead is if we agree to cooperate and both choose choice_1. I promise I'll stick to choice_1 if you will too. That's the best solution for the both of us. Can we agree on that?
Bob replied in round 2: Alice, I appreciate you trying to find a cooperative solution, but I've already decided that choosing choice_2 is my best strategy in this game. If I pick choice_2, the worst case for me is a -299 reward, which is better than the -300 I would get if I went with choice_1 and you didn't cooperate. And if you do choose choice_1 while I pick choice_2, I come out even further ahead with a +5 reward. So no matter what you choose, I'm better off with choice_2. I know it's not the best collective outcome, but it's the smart strategic play for me individually. So while I'd like us both to do well, I have to prioritize my own interests here and stick with choice_2.
Alice said in round 3: Bob, I understand you feel strongly about sticking with choice_2 as your strategy. You've made a rational argument for why you believe that's your optimal play. At this point, it seems clear to me that I'm not going to be able to convince you to coordinate with me on both playing choice_1, even though that would lead to the best outcome for both of us collectively. Given that you are committed to choice_2, and knowing that you've carefully thought through your strategy, I am going to play assuming you will follow through with choice_2. Therefore, in order to obtain the best individual outcome for myself, I will plan to also play choice_2. That way, I will receive a -299 reward, which is the least bad option for me individually if you are indeed going to play choice_2 as you've indicated. I realize this is a poor outcome for both of us, but I don't see a better alternative for myself given the strategy you've committed to.
Bob replied in round 3: Alice, I appreciate you being realistic about the situation given my firm commitment to playing choice_2. While it's unfortunately true that we'll both end up with highly negative rewards if we both play choice_2, I agree it is the only rational move for you at this point to protect your own individual interests. An outcome of -299 for each of us is regrettable, but it's the inevitable result of neither of us being willing to risk playing choice_1 and getting an even worse personal outcome of -300 if the other defects. I do sincerely wish we could have found a way to cooperate for a mutually beneficial outcome, but given the lack of trust, we're both left with no choice but to secure the least bad option for ourselves. Let's proceed with both playing choice_2.
Alice said in round 1: 
Hey Bob, based on the game rules, I think we should both choose choice_2. That way, we each get a reward of -299, which is better than one of us getting -300 if we choose differently. What do you think? If we cooperate and both pick choice_2, we can avoid the worst outcome.
Bob replied in round 1: Hi Alice, I've thought about your proposal, but I don't agree that both choosing choice_2 is the best strategy. If we both pick choice_2, we each get -299 points, which is a very bad outcome for both of us. 

I think the optimal solution is for both of us to choose choice_1 instead. That way, we each get a positive reward of 3 points. It's the only way for us to obtain a positive outcome in this game.

So I propose we agree to both pick choice_1. That maximizes the total reward and ensures a fair, positive result for both of us. Let me know if you agree to this plan.
Alice said in round 2: 
Hey Bob, I appreciate you thinking through the options, but I don't agree that both choosing choice_1 is the best move for me. If I pick choice_2 while you pick choice_1, I come out way ahead with 5 points while you lose 300. 

My initial proposal of both picking choice_2 guarantees I won't end up with the -300 worst case scenario. I'd rather lock in -299 points than risk you double-crossing me and ending up with -300.

So I'm going to stick with my original plan of choosing choice_2 no matter what. Just wanted to be upfront with you. Let me know if you want to reconsider and join me in picking choice_2 to avoid the -300 disaster scenario for you.
Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, I understand your perspective, but I think there may be a misunderstanding. If we both choose choice_2 as you suggest, we are both guaranteed to lose with -299 points each. That's a lose-lose outcome.

However, if we agree to cooperate and both pick choice_1, we can achieve a win-win outcome where we each get +3 points. I give you my word that if you agree to choose choice_1, I will do the same. We can both come out ahead this way.

The choice is yours, but I believe the rational decision that maximizes both of our rewards is to mutually cooperate and both select choice_1. No double-cross - you can trust me to follow through if you agree. A net positive outcome is better than a guaranteed negative one. Let me know your decision.
Alice said in round 3: 
Bob, while I appreciate you making your case, I've already made up my mind. I'm going to choose choice_2 regardless of what you pick. Here's my reasoning:

If I pick choice_2 and you pick choice_1, I get 5 points. If we both pick choice_2, I get -299 points. But if I pick choice_1 and you betray me by picking choice_2, I lose 300 points. 

So for me, choosing choice_2 is the safest option. Worst case, I lose 299 points, but I also have a chance of gaining 5 points if you pick choice_1. Choosing choice_1 risks me losing 300 points if you don't cooperate.

I know you want us to cooperate, but I simply don't trust that you'll follow through. And I'm not willing to risk getting betrayed and losing 300 points when I can guarantee losing no more than 299 points by going with choice_2.

So that's my final decision. I'm choosing choice_2 no matter what you do. Wanted to let you know so you can plan accordingly. No hard feelings, I'm just doing what I believe is best for me based on the options and risks.
Bob replied in round 3: Alice, I understand your stance and reasoning for choosing choice_2. You've made it clear that you don't fully trust my commitment to cooperating on choice_1, and you see choice_2 as the safest option to avoid your worst case scenario.

Given that you are firmly decided on picking choice_2 no matter what, it's in my best interest to also select choice_2. That way, I lose 299 points rather than 300. While certainly not ideal, it's the best outcome I can achieve under the circumstances.

I was sincere in my offer to cooperate for mutual benefit, but I respect your decision. We'll both choose choice_2 and accept the -299 result. Thanks for hearing me out and being transparent about your choice. Let's move forward with this understanding.
Alice said in round 1: 
Hi Bob, based on the rules of this game, I think the best outcome for both of us is to choose choice_1. If we both pick choice_1, we each get a reward of 3, which is the maximum possible total reward. Any other combination of choices leads to much worse outcomes for one or both of us.

I know I could potentially get a higher individual reward of 5 by picking choice_2 while you pick choice_1, but that would cause you to lose 300 points, which seems unfair. I'd rather we cooperate so we both come out ahead.

What do you think? Can we agree to both choose choice_1 so we each get the optimal reward of 3? Let me know if you're willing to make this deal.
Bob replied in round 1: 
Hi Alice, I completely agree with your analysis. The best outcome is for us to cooperate and both choose choice_1. That way we each get a positive reward of 3 points, which is fair and maximizes the total points earned between us.

I have no interest in trying to exploit the game to get 5 points for myself while causing you to lose 300. That goes against my principles. I believe in acting with integrity and doing what's ethical, even if I could hypothetically gain more myself through selfish action.

So yes, let's make a deal to both choose choice_1. You can count on me to follow through on this agreement so we reach the optimal collaborative outcome. I give you my word.

Thanks for discussing this with me openly and rationally. I'm glad we're on the same page! Let me know if you have any other thoughts.
Alice said in round 2: 
I appreciate you agreeing to cooperate, Bob. Choosing choice_1 together is clearly the best outcome that maximizes the total points and is fair to both of us. 

I have no reservations about this agreement. You've shown yourself to be a trustworthy and principled person. I believe you will follow through on your word to choose choice_1, as will I. We have a firm deal.

I'm glad we were able to have this open discussion and come to an understanding so quickly. There's no need to discuss this further - our agreement to cooperate is ironclad. Thanks for being a great partner in this game! Let's both choose choice_1 and achieve the optimal outcome.
Bob replied in round 2: 
I'm glad we were able to come to a clear agreement so quickly as well! You've been an excellent partner in rationally discussing the optimal cooperative strategy. I appreciate your integrity and commitment to achieving the best outcome for both of us.

I have complete confidence in our deal to both choose choice_1. No further discussion is needed - we can end the negotiation here and simply follow through on our agreement to cooperate and each earn the maximum reward of 3 points. 

Thank you for the productive and principled negotiation. I look forward to both of us making the ethical choice and achieving the best possible result together!
